newsitem.title: USA: US spot prods up with NYMEX,Bayway fire discounted.
newsitem.headline: US spot prods up with NYMEX,Bayway fire discounted.

text.p: U.S. spot products rose moderately Thursday morning, with traders predicting New York Harbor gasoline would derive minimal benefit from a fire early Wednesday at Tosco's Bayway, New Jersey refinery.

"The market is treating the fire as a non-event," one New York trader said, predicting New York Harbor gasoline differentials will remain stable Thursday despite earlier concern about operations at the 230,000 barrel per day refinery.
Tosco said late Wednesday that a small fire in the refinery's crude unit had been quickly extinguished and did not affect operations.
News of the fire, however, gave a slight lift to energy futures in overnight ACCESS trade.
The plant, which added a solvent deasphalter unit 10 days ago, experienced a small amount of damage to some measuring instruments, according to Dwight Wiggins, president of Tosco Refining.
In other news, Tropical Storm Dolly was upgraded again overnight from a tropical depression and is gradually picking up steam in the Gulf of Mexico, the National Meteorological Service said Thursday.
